an7.38:1.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with seven qualities will soon realize the four kinds of textual analysis and live having achieved them with their own insight.
an7.38:1.3: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is mental sluggishness’.
an7.38:1.4: They truly understand internally constricted mind as ‘internally constricted mind’.
an7.38:1.5: They truly understand externally scattered mind as ‘externally scattered mind’.
an7.38:1.6: They know feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
an7.38:1.7: They know perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
an7.38:1.8: They know thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
an7.38:1.9: The patterns of qualities—suitable or unsuitable, inferior or superior, or those on the side of dark or bright—are properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.
an7.38:1.10: A mendicant with these seven qualities will soon realize the four kinds of textual analysis and live having achieved them with their own insight.”
